subject: Re: JUnit Test Result Format" (XML): No evolution for years?
msgSnippet: Hi Charlie, ... Due to the fact that the JUnit test result xml format is now used in many tools AND a lot of these tools are not addressed to java only the
messageBody:
Hi Charlie,

> I'm curious... Do you view this as a JUnit format, a Java unit test
> format or a more
> general test reporting format?
Due to the fact that the "JUnit test result xml format" is now used in
many tools AND a lot of these tools are not addressed to java only the
next version should become a language-agnostic format (just to continue
that good process).

Best regards
Daniela Waranie
